block.p: Deborah Ann Schmidt, an executive at Sotheby's, the auction house, was married last evening to Rowland Perry Robinson, a medical student. The Rev. C. Hugh Hildesley, a colleague of the bride and an Episcopal minister, performed the ceremony at St. Jude's Episcopal Church in Seal Harbor, Me.

Mrs. Robinson, 33, is a vice president in the trusts and estates division at Sotheby's. She graduated from Sweet Briar College. She is the daughter of Ruth Ann and Edwin Schmidt of Brevard, N.C. The bride's father was the manager of international marketing, planning and research at the NCR Corporation, the manufacturer of automated teller machines and computers in Dayton, Ohio.

Deborah Ann Schmidt, an executive at Sotheby's, the auction house, was married last evening to Rowland Perry Robinson, a medical student. The Rev. C. Hugh Hildesley, a colleague of the bride and an Episcopal minister, performed the ceremony at St. Jude's Episcopal Church in Seal Harbor, Me.

Mrs. Robinson, 33, is a vice president in the trusts and estates division at Sotheby's. She graduated from Sweet Briar College. She is the daughter of Ruth Ann and Edwin Schmidt of Brevard, N.C. The bride's father was the manager of international marketing, planning and research at the NCR Corporation, the manufacturer of automated teller machines and computers in Dayton, Ohio.

Mr. Robinson, 34, is known as Perry. He graduated from Harvard University and is a candidate for a joint M.D. and M.B.A. degree from Columbia University. He is a son of Barbara and John Rowland Robinson of Greenwich, Conn. The bridegroom's mother owns the American Tradition Gallery of Fine Art in Greenwich, which specializes in 19th-century American art. His father, a former executive vice president for the Sperry & Hutchinson Company, which made S&H Green Stamps, is a lawyer in private practice in Greenwich and a founder of the Natural Resources Defense Council.
